newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Wall Street Journal - Oct 10.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Wall Street Journal - Oct 10.

text.p: Southern Co agreed to buy 80 percent of Consolidated Electric Power Asia Ltd of Hong Kong for $2.1 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported Thursday.
- Time Warner Inc doubled to $600 million the amount of cost cuts and "revenue enhancements" it intends to do after it buys Turner Broadcasting System Inc.

- U.S. Federal Trade Commission raises antitrust issues regarding PacifiCare Health Systems Inc's PHSYA.O proposed $2 billion acquisition of FHP International Corp, focusing on the combined giant's potential to dominate the Medicare HMO businesss.
- General Motors Corp is keeping its light truck assembly plants in the United States open for some time because it prepared for the strike in Canada.
- Ford Motor Co is expected to appoint Jacques Nasser as president of automotive operations. Nasser would replace Edward Hagenlocker, who is expected to become vice chairman.
- U.S. airlines think an Internal Revenue Service memorandum on the deductibility of some engine overhauls is being widely applied and putting safety into risk.
- Corning Inc will pay $119 million to settle charges over a billing scheme that occurred at a unit before Corning bought it.
- Investors put $16 billion into stock mutual funds in September.
- The Dow Jones industrial average lost 36.15 to 5,930.62 with bond prices and the U.S. dollar also ending lower.
- General Motors Corp's Hughes brings out a high- speed, satellite-to-personal computer data service for consumers.
- Fuji Photo Film Co Ltd won an exclusive agreement to supply paper to Ritz Camera Centers.
- The Securities and Exchange Commission adopted rule changes to curb abuses of offshore securities offerings.
